channel.title: June on CodeWithStu's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in June on CodeWithStu's Blog

item.title: Building Service Fabric Apps With VSTS YML Build Definitions
item.description: In my previous article, we setup a standarised build using the new YML build definitions within VSTS, using the .Net CLI tooling. In this article, we will use the same setup as our base, but we will build and publish a service fabric application.

item.title: Automated Builds in VSTS with YML Build Definitions
item.description: In this article we will explore a preview feature inside of Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) called YML Build Definitions. In essence, this allows you to change your build process from a .yml file in your git repository much in the same way as you can do with other services such as AppVeyor. During the article, we will setup a build definition for an Aspnet Core website.
